25namespace proto {
36template <typename Tuple>
37struct TransformToFieldsTuple;
38
48template <typename... Fields>
49struct TransformToFieldsTuple<std::tuple<Fields...>> {
50 using Type = std::tuple<typename fieldsTuple<Fields>::Type...>;
51};
52
61// Lookup helper that avoids out-of-bounds tuple_element instantiation
62template <typename Tuple, FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index,
63 bool AtEnd = (Index >= std::tuple_size_v<Tuple>)>
64struct FieldByNameImpl;
65
66// End of recursion: no such field
67template <typename Tuple, FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index>
68struct FieldByNameImpl<Tuple, NAME, Index, true> {
69 using type = void;
70};
71
72// Recursive case
73template <typename Tuple, FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index>
74struct FieldByNameImpl<Tuple, NAME, Index, false> {
75 using Curr = std::tuple_element_t<Index, Tuple>;
76 using type = std::conditional_t<
77 (Curr::NAME == NAME), Curr,
78 typename FieldByNameImpl<Tuple, NAME, Index + 1>::type>;
79};
80
81// Public alias: preserves the existing FieldByName<...>::type usage
82template <typename Tuple, FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index = 0>
83using FieldByName = FieldByNameImpl<Tuple, NAME, Index>;
84
104template <typename Fields, typename TCrc = CrcSoft>
105class FieldContainer {
106 public:
107 virtual ~FieldContainer() = default;
113 FieldContainer() = default;
114
118 using FieldsTuple = typename TransformToFieldsTuple<Fields>::Type;
119
130
131 using DataField =
132 typename FieldByName<FieldsTuple, FieldName::DATA_FIELD>::type;
133
134 using ReturnType = std::remove_const_t<std::remove_reference_t<
135 decltype(std::declval<const DataField&>().get_copy())>>;
136
145 void set_debug(const bool DEBUG) { m_debug = DEBUG; }
146
152 [[nodiscard]] auto is_debug() const -> bool { return m_debug; }
153
157 static constexpr std::size_t SIZE = std::tuple_size_v<FieldsTuple>;
158
170 template <FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index = 0>
171 constexpr auto get() -> auto& {
172 if constexpr (Index >= std::tuple_size_v<decltype(m_fields)>) {
173 return std::get<0>(m_fields); // or throw an exception
174 } else if constexpr (std::tuple_element_t<Index,
175 decltype(m_fields)>::NAME ==
176 NAME) {
177 return std::get<Index>(m_fields);
178 } else {
179 return get<NAME, Index + 1>();
180 }
181 }
182
192 template <uint64_t INDEX>
193 constexpr auto get() -> auto& {
194 return std::get<INDEX>(m_fields);
195 }
196
206 template <FieldName NAME, std::size_t Index = 0>
207 static constexpr auto has_field() -> bool {
208 if constexpr (Index >= std::tuple_size_v<FieldsTuple>) {
209 return false;
210 } else if constexpr (std::tuple_element_t<Index, FieldsTuple>::NAME ==
211 NAME) {
212 return true;
213 } else {
214 return has_field<NAME, Index + 1>();
215 }
216 }
217
226 virtual void reset() {
227 this->m_crc.reset();
228 this->for_each_type([&](auto& field) { field.reset(); });
229 for (auto& [key, value] : m_offsets) {
230 value = 0;
231 }
232 m_field_index = 0;
233 }
234
244 template <typename Func>
245 constexpr void for_each_type(Func&& FUNC) {
246 constexpr std::size_t TUPLE_SIZE = std::tuple_size_v<FieldsTuple>;
247 for_each_type_impl(this->m_fields, std::forward<Func>(FUNC),
248 std::make_index_sequence<TUPLE_SIZE>{});
249 }
250
251 // --- Build a tuple of named types deduced the same way as ReturnType
252 // Each element keeps the field's compile-time name and the type
253 // produced by Field::get_copy() for that concrete field.
254
255 // Helper: deduce raw copy type and normalize it
256 template <class Field>
257 using _field_copy_raw_t = std::remove_const_t<std::remove_reference_t<
258 decltype(std::declval<const Field&>().get_copy())>>;
259
260 // If get_copy returns pointer -> turn into std::vector<non-const T>
261 template <class T>
262 struct PtrToVec {
263 using type = T;
264 };
265 template <class U>
266 struct PtrToVec<U*> {
267 using type = std::vector<std::remove_const_t<U>>;
268 };
269 template <class U>
270 struct PtrToVec<const U*> {
271 using type = std::vector<std::remove_const_t<U>>;
272 };
273
274 // If get_copy returns std::vector<const T> -> make it std::vector<T>
275 template <class T>
276 struct StripConstFromVector {
277 using type = T;
278 };
279 template <class U, class Alloc>
280 struct StripConstFromVector<std::vector<U, Alloc>> {
281 using type = std::vector<std::remove_const_t<U>>;
282 };
283
284 template <class Field>
285 using _field_copy_t = typename StripConstFromVector<
286 typename PtrToVec<_field_copy_raw_t<Field>>::type>::type;
287
288 // Named holder: stores compile-time field name and value type
289 template <FieldName NAME_, class T_>
290 struct NamedCopyType {
291 static constexpr FieldName NAME = NAME_;
292 using value_type = T_;
293 };
294
295 // Make a tuple of named copy types for all fields in FieldsTuple
296 template <typename Tuple_>
297 struct MakeReturnTuple;
298
299 template <typename... Field>
300 struct MakeReturnTuple<std::tuple<Field...>> {
301 using Type =
302 std::tuple<NamedCopyType<Field::NAME, _field_copy_t<Field>>...>;
303 };
304
305 // Public alias: tuple of elements with (NAME, value_type) matching get_copy()
306 // of each field
307 using ReturnValuesTuple = typename MakeReturnTuple<FieldsTuple>::Type;
308
309 // --- Runtime return tuples with actual copied values ---
310 // 1) Tuple of pure value types (without name wrappers)
311 template <typename Tuple>
312 struct MakeValueTuple;
313
314 template <typename... Field>
315 struct MakeValueTuple<std::tuple<Field...>> {
316 using Type = std::tuple<_field_copy_t<Field>...>;
317 };
318
319 using ReturnTuple = typename MakeValueTuple<FieldsTuple>::Type;
320
321 // 2) Named value element that carries compile-time name and a runtime value
322 template <FieldName NAME_, class T_>
323 struct NamedValue {
324 static constexpr FieldName NAME = NAME_;
325 T_ m_value; // runtime copy
326 };
327
328 // 3) Tuple of named values (compile-time name + runtime value)
329 template <typename Tuple>
330 struct MakeNamedValueTuple;
331
332 template <typename... Field>
333 struct MakeNamedValueTuple<std::tuple<Field...>> {
334 using Type = std::tuple<NamedValue<Field::NAME, _field_copy_t<Field>>...>;
335 };
336
337 // --- helpers for GetCopies / GetNamedCopies ---
338 template <std::size_t... Is>
339 [[nodiscard]] auto get_copies_impl(
340 std::index_sequence<Is...> /*unused*/) const -> ReturnTuple {
341 const auto& tup = this->m_fields;
342 return ReturnTuple{(normalize_value(std::get<Is>(tup).get_copy()))...};
343 }
344
345 using NamedReturnTuple = typename MakeNamedValueTuple<FieldsTuple>::Type;
346
347 // Copy every field and return a tuple of raw values
348 [[nodiscard]] auto get_copies() const -> ReturnTuple {
349 return GetCopiesImpl(
350 std::make_index_sequence<std::tuple_size_v<FieldsTuple>>{});
351 }
352
353 // Copy every field and return a tuple of named values
354 [[nodiscard]] auto get_named_copies() const -> NamedReturnTuple {
355 return get_named_copies_impl(
356 std::make_index_sequence<std::tuple_size_v<FieldsTuple>>{});
357 }
358
359 template <std::size_t... Is>
360 [[nodiscard]] auto get_named_copies_impl(
361 std::index_sequence<Is...> /*unused*/) const -> NamedReturnTuple {
362 const auto& tup = this->m_fields;
363 return NamedReturnTuple{
364 NamedValue<std::tuple_element_t<Is, FieldsTuple>::NAME,
365 _field_copy_t<std::tuple_element_t<Is, FieldsTuple>>>{
366 normalize_value(std::get<Is>(tup).get_copy())}...};
367 }
368
369 protected:
373 bool m_debug = false;
377 FieldsTuple m_fields;
382 std::unordered_map<uint8_t*, size_t> m_offsets;
386 TCrc m_crc{};
390 size_t m_field_index{};
391
402 template <typename Tuple, typename Func, std::size_t... Is>
403 constexpr void for_each_type_impl(Tuple& obj, Func&& FUNC,
404 std::index_sequence<Is...> /*unused*/) {
405 (FUNC.template operator()<std::tuple_element_t<Is, Tuple>>(
406 std::get<Is>(obj)),
407 ...);
408 }
409
410 private:
414 static constexpr std::size_t COUNT = std::tuple_size_v<decltype(m_fields)>;
415
416 // value normalizer for runtime conversion
417 template <class V>
418 static auto normalize_value(V&& VAL) {
419 return std::forward<V>(VAL);
420 }
421 template <class U>
422 static auto normalize_value(const std::vector<const U>& VAL) {
423 return std::vector<std::remove_const_t<U>>(VAL.begin(), VAL.end());
424 }
425 template <class U>
426 static auto normalize_value(std::vector<const U>&& VAL) {
427 return std::vector<std::remove_const_t<U>>(VAL.begin(), VAL.end());
428 }
429};

Variant DATA field that maps protocol IDs to payload types at compile time.
